snippet: Efforts to get noncitizens off the voter rolls are relying on outdated information, the Justice Department says, and are taking place too close to the next election.
abstract: Justice Dept sues Florida over its plan to remove noncitizens from its voter rolls; says efforts to remove up 2,600 voters who may be registered illegally are relying on outdated information and are taking place too close to the state's primary.
lead_paragraph: Efforts to get noncitizens off the voter rolls are relying on outdated information, the Justice Department says, and are taking place too close to the next election.

headline.seo: Justice Department Sues Florida Over Voter Purge
headline.main: Florida’s Approach to Purging Voter Rolls of Noncitizens Prompts Federal Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Florida’s Approach to Purging Voter Rolls of Noncitizens Prompts Federal Lawsuit
